name: Action Options
description: On each of your turns during combat, you can take one action. The available actions include Attack, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Influence, Magic, Ready, Search, Study, and Utilize. Class features and other abilities may grant additional action options. You are not required to take an action on your turn.
shortDescription: On your turn you may take one action chosen from a list of standard options: Attack, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Influence, Magic, Ready, Search, Study, or Utilize.
flavorText: In the chaos of combat, every heartbeat counts. What you do in those crucial seconds can mean the difference between triumph and disaster.
rulesAsWritten: When you take your turn, you can take one action. The actions available to every creature are Attack, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Influence, Magic, Ready, Search, Study, and Utilize. Your class, feats, and other features may provide additional action options.

relatedConditions.note: An Incapacitated creature cannot take actions.
A Stunned creature is Incapacitated and therefore cannot take actions.
A Paralyzed creature is Incapacitated and cannot take actions.
A Petrified creature is Incapacitated and cannot take actions.
An Unconscious creature is Incapacitated and cannot take actions.
The Hide action can be used to become hidden; Invisibility facilitates hiding.

applicationLogic.name: Attack
applicationLogic.description: You make one attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike. When you gain the Extra Attack feature, you can make more than one attack when you take this action. Each attack is a separate roll and can target a different creature. You choose a target in range and make an attack roll. Melee attacks have a default reach of 5 feet; ranged attacks use the weapon's range.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Attack action on its turn

effects.description: Make one melee or ranged attack roll using a weapon or Unarmed Strike. On a hit, deal the weapon's or Unarmed Strike's damage.
effects.mechanicalNote: Roll d20 + ability modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient) vs. target's AC. Strength for melee weapons and Unarmed Strikes; Dexterity for ranged weapons. Finesse weapons allow the attacker to choose STR or DEX.

applicationLogic.name: Dash
applicationLogic.description: When you take the Dash action, you gain extra movement for the current turn. The increase equals your Speed after applying any modifiers. With a Speed of 30 feet, for example, you can move up to 60 feet on your turn if you Dash. Any increase or decrease to your Speed changes this additional movement by the same amount.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Dash action on its turn

modifier.note: Gain extra movement equal to your Speed for the current turn (effectively doubling total movement available).

applicationLogic.name: Disengage
applicationLogic.description: If you take the Disengage action, your movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks for the rest of the current turn.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Disengage action on its turn

immunity.note: Movement does not provoke Opportunity Attacks for the rest of the turn.

applicationLogic.name: Dodge
applicationLogic.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has Disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with Advantage. You lose this benefit if you have the Incapacitated condition or if your Speed drops to 0.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Dodge action and maintains it until the start of its next turn; must not be Incapacitated and Speed must be > 0

imposition.condition: The dodging creature can see the attacker
imposition.note: Attack rolls against the dodging creature have Disadvantage.

grant.note: Dexterity saving throws are made with Advantage while dodging.

applicationLogic.name: Help
applicationLogic.description: When you take the Help action, you do one of the following. Assist an Ability Check: Choose one of your skill or tool proficiencies and one ally who is near enough for you to assist verbally or physically (DM determines the distance). That ally has Advantage on the next ability check they make with the chosen skill or tool. This benefit expires if the ally doesn't use it before the start of your next turn. Assist an Attack Roll: You momentarily distract an enemy within 5 feet of you, giving Advantage on the next attack roll by an ally against that enemy. This benefit expires at the start of your next turn.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Help action, choosing to assist either an ability check or an attack roll

grant.condition: Ally must use it before the start of the helper's next turn; applies to one specific skill or tool proficiency chosen at time of helping
grant.note: The ally has Advantage on the next ability check they make with the chosen skill or tool.

grant.condition: The helper must be within 5 feet of the enemy; benefit expires at the start of the helper's next turn
grant.note: The next attack roll an ally makes against the distracted enemy has Advantage.

applicationLogic.name: Hide
applicationLogic.description: With the Hide action, you try to conceal yourself. To do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity (Stealth) check while you're Heavily Obscured or behind Three-Quarters Cover or Total Cover, and you must be out of any enemy's line of sight. On a successful check, you have the Invisible condition. Make note of your check's total, which is the DC for a creature to find you with a Wisdom (Perception) check. The condition ends on you immediately after any of the following: you make a sound louder than a whisper, an enemy finds you, you make an attack roll, or you cast a spell with a Verbal component.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Hide action while Heavily Obscured or behind Three-Quarters or Total Cover and out of enemy line of sight

effects.description: Make a DC 15 Dexterity (Stealth) check. On success, gain the Invisible condition. The check total becomes the DC for enemies to find you with a Wisdom (Perception) check.
effects.mechanicalNote: Roll d20 + DEX modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient in Stealth) vs. DC 15. Invisible condition ends if you: make a sound louder than a whisper, are found by an enemy, make an attack roll, or cast a spell with a Verbal component.

savingThrow.onSuccess: Gain the Invisible condition; check total becomes the DC for enemies to find you
savingThrow.onFailure: Fail to hide; no Invisible condition granted

imposition.note: Requires Heavily Obscured, Three-Quarters Cover, or Total Cover and no enemy line of sight. Invisible condition ends upon making a louder-than-whisper sound, being found, making an attack roll, or casting a spell with a Verbal component.

applicationLogic.name: Influence
applicationLogic.description: With the Influence action, you urge a monster to do something. Describe or roleplay what you're trying to get the creature to do. The DM then determines which ability check to make (typically Charisma-based using Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion), and the DC is based on the creature's attitude and the nature of the request.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Influence action to urge a monster to do something

effects.description: Make a Charisma-based ability check (typically Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion) against a DC set by the DM based on the target's attitude (Indifferent, Friendly, or Hostile) and the nature of the request.
effects.mechanicalNote: DM sets the DC. The target's current attitude modifies the difficulty. On success, the creature does as urged; on failure, it may become hostile or resistant to further influence.

applicationLogic.name: Magic
applicationLogic.description: When you take the Magic action, you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action, or you use a feature or magic item that requires a Magic action to be activated. If you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 minute or longer, you must take the Magic action on each turn of that casting, and you must maintain Concentration while doing so. If your Concentration is broken, the spell fails, but you don't expend a spell slot.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Magic action to cast a spell or activate a magical feature or item

effects.description: Cast a spell with a casting time of an action, or activate a feature or magic item that requires a Magic action. Spells with longer casting times require taking the Magic action each turn and maintaining Concentration until the casting is complete.
effects.mechanicalNote: A spell with a casting time longer than one action requires the Magic action each turn of the casting and Concentration. If Concentration is broken, the spell fails but no spell slot is expended.

applicationLogic.name: Ready
applicationLogic.description: You take the Ready action to wait for a particular circumstance before you act. You decide what perceivable circumstance will trigger your Reaction and then choose the action you will take in response to that trigger (or you choose to move up to your Speed in response to it). When the trigger occurs, you can either take your Reaction right after the trigger finishes or ignore the trigger. If you ready a spell, you cast it as normal but hold its energy, which you release with your Reaction when the trigger occurs. A readied spell requires Concentration to hold.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Ready action on its turn, specifying a trigger and a response action

effects.description: Choose a perceivable trigger and a response action (or movement up to your Speed). When the trigger occurs, use your Reaction to take the response. If readying a spell, cast it normally but hold its energy with Concentration, releasing it via Reaction when the trigger occurs.
effects.mechanicalNote: Uses your Reaction. If readying a spell: the spell slot is expended at the time of casting (not the trigger), and requires Concentration to hold. If Concentration is broken before the trigger, the spell is lost. If the trigger never occurs, the action is wasted.

applicationLogic.name: Search
applicationLogic.description: When you take the Search action, you make a Wisdom check to discern something that isn't obvious. The DM determines the applicable check: Wisdom (Insight) for reading body language, Wisdom (Medicine) for diagnosing illness, Wisdom (Perception) for finding a hidden creature or object, or Wisdom (Survival) for tracking.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Search action to find or discern something not immediately apparent

effects.description: Make a Wisdom-based ability check as determined by the DM: Insight for reading body language, Medicine for diagnosing illness, Perception for finding hidden creatures or objects, or Survival for tracking.
effects.mechanicalNote: The DM sets the DC based on how well hidden or obscured the target is. This replaces the old 'Search' and 'Perception check as an action' rules.

applicationLogic.name: Study
applicationLogic.description: When you take the Study action, you make an Intelligence check to study your memory, a book, a clue, or another source of knowledge and call to mind an important piece of information about it. The DM determines the applicable check: Intelligence (Arcana) for spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, and planes of existence; Intelligence (History) for historical events, peoples, kingdoms, and battles; Intelligence (Investigation) for traps, ciphers, riddles, and gadgetry; Intelligence (Nature) for terrain, flora, weather, and natural cycles; Intelligence (Religion) for deities, rites, holy symbols, and the practices of cults.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Study action to recall or discern knowledge

effects.description: Make an Intelligence-based ability check as determined by the DM: Arcana, History, Investigation, Nature, or Religion. On a success, recall or discern an important piece of information.
effects.mechanicalNote: The DM sets the DC. This is a new action in the 2024 rules, consolidating recall and investigation-type knowledge checks into a single action framework.

applicationLogic.name: Utilize
applicationLogic.description: You normally interact with an object while doing something else, such as when you draw a sword as part of the Attack action. When an object requires an action for its use, you take the Utilize action. This action is also useful when you want to interact with more than one object on your turn.

trigger.condition: Creature takes the Utilize action to interact with an object that requires an action or to interact with multiple objects on the same turn

effects.description: Use an object that requires an action, or interact with a second object on your turn (the first object interaction is free as part of another action or movement).
effects.mechanicalNote: Examples include administering a potion to another creature, using a Healer's Kit, lighting a torch with a Tinderbox, or donning/doffing a Shield. This replaces the old 'Use an Object' action.

stacking.stackingNote: Only one action per turn unless a feature (e.g., Action Surge) grants an additional action. Bonus Actions and Reactions are separate from the action.

dmNotes: Players can also attempt creative actions not listed here. The DM adjudicates these using ability checks or improvised rulings. The Dodge action's benefits end immediately if the creature is Incapacitated or its Speed is reduced to 0. The Hide action's DC 15 Stealth check is a flat DC in 2024 rulesâ€”this is a notable change from previous editions where it was contested. The Study action is new to the 2024 rules and provides a dedicated action for knowledge checks.

commonRulings.question: Can you take an action not listed in the standard action options?
commonRulings.ruling: Yes. The DM can allow creative actions and adjudicate them using ability checks. The listed actions are the codified options, but the DM has final say on improvised actions.

commonRulings.question: Can you split your movement around an action (e.g., move, Attack, move)?
commonRulings.ruling: Yes. You can break up your movement on your turn, moving before and after your action. Each foot of movement costs 1 foot from your Speed.

commonRulings.question: If you take the Dash action, does it stack with other sources of Dash (e.g., Rogue's Cunning Action)?
commonRulings.ruling: Yes. Each Dash grants additional movement equal to your Speed. If you Dash twice (once as an action, once as a Bonus Action), you gain your Speed in extra movement twice.

commonRulings.question: Does the Dodge action work against attacks you can't see?
commonRulings.ruling: No. You must be able to see the attacker for attack rolls against you to have Disadvantage. The Advantage on Dexterity saving throws applies regardless of sight.

commonRulings.question: What is the DC for the Hide action in the 2024 rules?
commonRulings.ruling: The DC is a flat 15 for the Dexterity (Stealth) check. This is no longer a contested check. You must be Heavily Obscured or behind Three-Quarters or Total Cover and out of enemy line of sight.

commonRulings.question: What happens if the trigger for a Readied action never occurs?
commonRulings.ruling: If the trigger never occurs before the start of your next turn, the Ready action is wasted. If you readied a spell, the spell slot is still expended.
